TopicTitle: First Attempt At Cargo SSTO in 1.0.2 : Does 18+ tons to orbit

Articles.Content:
Not much of a pilot. Prefer to use the rockets, but after some success with a small passenger shuttle and passenger SSTO for cycling kerbals and leveling them up, I tried to make a cargo carrying SSTO. It worked on the second try with an 8 Jet engines instead of 6. It can lift 18 tons (2 locked X200-16 tanks) to 80 km, with plenty of fuel to spare. 

To Orbit: Take off at 20Ã‚Â° to 10 km, then 15Ã‚Â° until velocity no longer increases, start rocket engine, go back to 20Ã‚Â°, turn off jet engines once they give out (custom 2), turn off air intakes (custom 1), continue until apogee of 81 km is reached, coast at 10Ã‚Â° until above 70 km, circularize. 

To Land: Retroburn at ~90Ã‚Â° past spaceport. I used Mechjeb to see predicted landing spot, have it at 550~575 km before spaceport, put all fuel in furthest forward tank, balance oxidizer or dump almost all of it via fuel transfer mod (keep some for fuel cells). Maintain 10Ã‚Â° angle during re-entry until 600 m/s, dive as low as -45Ã‚Â° angle to 5 km, turn on engines to 1/3 thrust, level off at 3 km, cut engines before landing to glide in at 50~100 m/s.

**Any improvements recommended?**

What are the statistics of this aircraft? (i.e. base weight, blah blah)
117.26 ton wet mass but no cargo, 64.767 tons dry mass. At least 13.2% cargo mass to orbit. The craft file should give you all you need.
Replacing half of the jets with Rapiers improves performance a little. The Rapiers are never used in Rocket mode though.
